definition: (idiom) to be exposed to the elements
to blow/to play a wind instrument/to blast/to puff/to boast/to brag/to end in failure/to fall through
abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan

(of the sun) to shine on/to bask in (the sunshine)/to dry (clothes, grain etc) in the sun/(fig.) to expose and share (one's experiences and thoughts) on the Web (loanword from "share")/(coll.) to give the cold shoulder to

sentences.english: The ancient tower still stops up,exposed to the weather for ages.
sentences.chinese: 經過長年累月的風吹日曬，那座古塔依然豎立在那裏。

sentences.english: All were tanned to the color of bronze from wind and sun.
sentences.chinese: 因爲風吹日曬，大家都曬成了古銅色。

sentences.english: A simple canopy helps block the sun and wind.
sentences.chinese: 爲乘客遮擋風吹日曬的惟有一張帆布篷而已。

definition: scorched and drenched by sun and rain (idiom); suffer from exposure to the elements/weather-beaten
lit. windswept and battered by rain/to undergo hardship (idiom)
to drip with sweat/sweat poured off (him)
(of the sun) to scorch/to expose to a scorching sun
to be of no interest to anyone (idiom)
to let air pass through/to ventilate
